intro: Dregea formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan dregea, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia, particularly Taiwan. It is a member of the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a rough texture. The fruit is a follicle that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its propagation in natural habitats.
